definition: to resell
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt

sentences.english: They later sell these “clones”, sometimes to the firms on which they were modelled.
sentences.chinese: 之后他们再适时把这些“克隆公司”转卖给母体公司。

sentences.english: Once the home is foreclosed , the goal is to resell it quickly.
sentences.chinese: 一旦家被封死了，我们的目标是迅速转卖。

sentences.english: He has no right to sell her to foreigners, because he has broken faith with her.
sentences.chinese: 主人是没有权力再把她转卖给外族人的。

sentences.english: How could you sell the mortgage on my farm to the gringos?
sentences.chinese: 你怎能把我农场的贷款权状转卖给格林可帮的人？

definition: to pass on/to resell/to change hands
to resell at a profit/to speculate
to sell cheaply/sacrifice/low price/discount sale
to sell off (one's property)
to sell/to offer for sale/to put on the market
to sell off/to get rid of in a sale
to purchase/to acquire
to sell/to peddle/to traffic
to shift from one hand to the other/to change hands (of merchandise)
low price
to provide (an asset) as security for a loan/to put up collateral
to repay a debt in kind or by labor
customer
to transfer (ownership, rights etc)
to gain profit (by underhand means)/to exploit/exploitation
to smuggle
